intro: Wahlbergella vahlii, commonly known as the Vahli's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Wahlbergella vahlii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
